brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is the development of noninvasive (having no direct contact)
      detector and electronic system that will directly measure tumor blood flow rate.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study of Tumor Blood Flow Measurement by Detection of Positron Activation Post Proton Therapy (DS01)
clinical_study.condition: Brain Cancer, Prostate Cancer, Lung Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Solid tumors in the intracranial, thoracic, or pelvic regions.

        Exclusion Criteria: N/A

        -

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated at radiation oncology clinic

facility.name: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of Tumor Blood Flow Measurement by Detection of Positron Activation Post Proton Therapy

overall_official.affiliation: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

primary_outcome.measure: Patients with hypoxic tumor identified by tumor blood flow measurement.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
